greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Triangle of coefficients of polynomials v(n,x) jointly generated with A209146; see the Formula section.
comment: For a discussion and guide to related arrays, see A208510.
As triangle T(n,k) with 0 <= k <= n, it is (3, -1, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0, ...) DELTA (1, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0, ...) where DELTA is the operator defined in A084938. - _Philippe Deléham_, Mar 08 2012
A skew triangle of A209144. - _Philippe Deléham_, Mar 08 2012
Riordan array ( (1 + x)/(1 - 2*x), x/(1 - 2*x) ). Cf. A118800. Matrix inverse is a signed version of A112626. - _Peter Bala_, Jul 17 2013
formula: T(n,k) = 2*T(n-1,k) + T(n-1,k-1), T(0,0) = 1, T(1,0) = 3, T(1,1) = 1, T(n,k) = 0 if k < 0 or if k > n. - _Philippe Deléham_, Mar 08 2012
As DELTA-triangle: G.f. is (1+x)/(1-2*x-yx). - _Philippe Deléham_, Mar 08 2012
example: First three polynomials v(n,x): 1, 3 + x, 6 + 5x + x^2.
v(n,x) = (3 + x)*(2 + x)^(n-2)for n > 1. - _Philippe Deléham_, Mar 08 2012
results.author: _Clark Kimberling_, Mar 07 2012
